nodes.text: David Acord is a sound editor who works for Skywalker Sound. Acord served as Apprentice Sound Editor on Attack of the Clones, Assistant Sound Editor on Revenge of the Sith, Supervising Assistant [Sound Editor] on the DVD release of the original trilogy, and sound designer (and later re-recording mixer; sound designer/sound editor on film) on Star Wars: The Clone Wars, sound designer/re-recording mixer on "LEGO Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Out," and sound designer/supervising sound editor on "Star Wars Rebels." He further worked on the sound editing for Star Wars: The Force Awakens, receiving an Oscar nomination for his work.

He also provided the voice of the GH-7 medical droid in Revenge of the Sith. Due to this cameo, he named his Star Wars blog Experimental Surgery with GH-7, after the medical assistant. In 2015, Acord was the voice of a riot control stormtrooper designated FN-2199 in Star Wars: The Force Awakens, a minor role which nevertheless proved popular with fans.
